Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

nodes.body:
### PR summary [b016b187bd](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14429/commits/b016b187bd0696bd5587c102a0a1a1db3e68f19d)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsOpenImmersion.of_isLocalization`
`+ disjointGlueData`
`+ disjointGlueData'`
`+ disjoint_opensRange_sigmaŒπ`
`+ exists_sigmaŒπ_eq`
`+ iSup_opensRange_sigmaŒπ`
`+ instance (i) : IsOpenImmersion (Sigma.Œπ f i) := by`
`+ instance : CreatesColimit (Discrete.functor f) Scheme.forgetToLocallyRingedSpace`
`+ instance : CreatesColimitsOfShape (Discrete Œπ) Scheme.forgetToLocallyRingedSpace := by`
`+ instance : HasCoproducts.{0} Scheme.{u} := has_smallest_coproducts_of_hasCoproducts`
`+ instance : HasCoproducts.{u} Scheme.{u}`
`+ instance : PreservesColimitsOfShape (Discrete Œπ) Scheme.forgetToTop`
`+ instance {R} [CommRing R] (f : R) :`
`+ instance {Œπ : Type} : PreservesColimitsOfShape (Discrete Œπ) Scheme.forgetToLocallyRingedSpace`
`+ instance {Œπ : Type} : PreservesColimitsOfShape (Discrete Œπ) Scheme.forgetToTop`
`+ sigmaIsoGlued`
`+ sigmaMk`
`+ sigmaMk_mk`
`+ sigmaOpenCover`
`+ sigmaŒπ_eq_iff`
`+ toLocallyRingedSpaceCoproductCofan`
`+ toLocallyRingedSpaceCoproductCofanIsColimit`
`+ Œπ_sigmaIsoGlued_hom`
`+ Œπ_sigmaIsoGlued_inv`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

What do you think of including something like the following, to golf the disjoint union proof?
```lean
structure GlueData' where
  J : Type v
  U : J ‚Üí C
  V : J √ó J ‚Üí C
  f : ‚àÄ i j, V (i, j) ‚ü∂ U i
  f_mono : ‚àÄ i j, Mono (f i j) := by infer_instance
  f_hasPullback : ‚àÄ i j k, HasPullback (f i j) (f i k) := by infer_instance
  f_id : ‚àÄ i, IsIso (f i i) := by infer_instance
  t : ‚àÄ i j, V (i, j) ‚ü∂ V (j, i)
  t_id : ‚àÄ i, t i i = ùüô _
  t' : ‚àÄ i j k, pullback (f i j) (f i k) ‚ü∂ pullback (f j k) (f j i)
  t_fac : ‚àÄ i j k, t' i j k ‚â´ pullback.snd = pullback.fst ‚â´ t i j
  t_inv' : ‚àÄ i j, i ‚â† j ‚Üí t i j ‚â´ t j i = ùüô _
  cocycle : ‚àÄ i j k, i ‚â† j ‚Üí j ‚â† k ‚Üí k ‚â† i ‚Üí t' i j k ‚â´ t' j k i ‚â´ t' k i j = ùüô _

namespace GlueData'

attribute [simp] t_id
attribute [instance] f_id f_mono f_hasPullback
attribute [reassoc] t_fac cocycle

variable {C}
variable (D : GlueData' C)

@[simp]
theorem t'_iij (i j : D.J) : D.t' i i j = (pullbackSymmetry _ _).hom := by
  have eq‚ÇÅ := D.t_fac i i j
  have eq‚ÇÇ := (IsIso.eq_comp_inv (D.f i i)).mpr (@pullback.condition _ _ _ _ _ _ (D.f i j) _)
  rw [D.t_id, Category.comp_id, eq‚ÇÇ] at eq‚ÇÅ
  have eq‚ÇÉ := (IsIso.eq_comp_inv (D.f i i)).mp eq‚ÇÅ
  rw [Category.assoc, ‚Üê pullback.condition, ‚Üê Category.assoc] at eq‚ÇÉ
  exact
    Mono.right_cancellation _ _
      ((Mono.right_cancellation _ _ eq‚ÇÉ).trans (pullbackSymmetry_hom_comp_fst _ _).symm)

theorem t'_jii (i j : D.J) : D.t' j i i = pullback.fst ‚â´ D.t j i ‚â´ inv pullback.snd := by
  rw [‚Üê Category.assoc, ‚Üê D.t_fac]
  simp

theorem t'_iji (i j : D.J) : D.t' i j i = pullback.fst ‚â´ D.t i j ‚â´ inv pullback.snd := by
  rw [‚Üê Category.assoc, ‚Üê D.t_fac]
  simp

@[reassoc, elementwise (attr := simp)]
theorem t_inv (i j : D.J) : D.t i j ‚â´ D.t j i = ùüô _ := by
  by_cases h : i = j
  ¬∑ subst h
    simp
  ¬∑ exact D.t_inv' _ _ h

theorem t'_inv (i j k : D.J) :
    D.t' i j k ‚â´ (pullbackSymmetry _ _).hom ‚â´ D.t' j i k ‚â´ (pullbackSymmetry _ _).hom = ùüô _ := by
  rw [‚Üê cancel_mono (pullback.fst : pullback (D.f i j) (D.f i k) ‚ü∂ _)]
  simp [t_fac, t_fac_assoc]

instance t_isIso (i j : D.J) : IsIso (D.t i j) :=
  ‚ü®‚ü®D.t j i, D.t_inv _ _, D.t_inv _ _‚ü©‚ü©

-- instance t'_isIso (i j k : D.J) : IsIso (D.t' i j k) :=
--   ‚ü®‚ü®D.t' j k i ‚â´ D.t' k i j, D.cocycle _ _ _, by simpa using D.cocycle _ _ _‚ü©‚ü©

def glueData (D : GlueData' C) : GlueData C where
  __ := D
  cocycle i j k := by
    dsimp
    by_cases hij : i = j
    ¬∑ subst hij
      rw [D.t'_iij, D.t'_jii, D.t'_iji]
      ext
      ¬∑ simp [fst_eq_snd_of_mono_eq, t_inv_assoc]
      ¬∑ simp [fst_eq_snd_of_mono_eq]
    by_cases hjk : j = k
    ¬∑ subst hjk
      rw [D.t'_iij, D.t'_jii, D.t'_iji]
      ext
      ¬∑ simp [fst_eq_snd_of_mono_eq, t_inv_assoc]
      ¬∑ simp [fst_eq_snd_of_mono_eq]
    by_cases hki : k = i
    ¬∑ subst hki
      rw [D.t'_iij, D.t'_jii, D.t'_iji]
      ext
      ¬∑ simp [fst_eq_snd_of_mono_eq, t_inv_assoc]
      ¬∑ rw [‚Üê cancel_mono (D.f k k)]
        simp [fst_eq_snd_of_mono_eq, t_inv_assoc, pullback.condition]
    exact D.cocycle i j k hij hjk hki

end GlueData'
```

GlueData' is indeed useful; my [GlueData.mk‚ÇÇ](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14167/files#diff-84f8c7bdded56b516d33e74834faf603f2a1cc1c213351b2f10f72a851b94cfcR78-R96) is a baby version of it. But maybe we can add the `i ‚â† j` conditions to `V, f, f_mono, f_hasPullback, t, t', t_fac` and get rid of `f_id` and `t_id`?

Hmmm, then the data becomes a dependent function... and we would get even more `if then else`s everywhere. I suppose it could work...

At least, I think we can consider splitting the data into a structure (maybe this can be called `GlueData`?) and then different kinds of ways to check the axioms can be put on top of that.
I'll try out the approach Johan mentioned. `GlueData.mk‚ÇÇ` is definitely useful, but I don't think we should introduce `if then else` everywhere.
After some more thought, I think `GlueData'` is only useful when `i = j` and `i =/= j` need different approaches, so maybe adding `i ‚â† j` in the data makes sense as well.

There is quite a lot going on in this PR. I see at least four contributions:
1. `GlueData'`
2. Disjoint unions of schemes.
3. Disjoint unions of prime spectra.
4. General API about pullbacks/pushouts/strict initials.

It would be much easier to review this important work if you could break up this PR into smaller pieces.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14548~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14549~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14550~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14551~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

nodes.body:
What do you think of including something like the following, to golf the disjoint union proof?
```lean
structure GlueData' where
  J : Type v
  U : J ‚Üí C
  V : J √ó J ‚Üí C
  f : ‚àÄ i j, V (i, j) ‚ü∂ U i
  f_mono : ‚àÄ i j, Mono (f i j) := by infer_instance
  f_hasPullback : ‚àÄ i j k, HasPullback (f i j) (f i k) := by infer_instance
  f_id : ‚àÄ i, IsIso (f i i) := by infer_instance
  t : ‚àÄ i j, V (i, j) ‚ü∂ V (j, i)
  t_id : ‚àÄ i, t i i = ùüô _
  t' : ‚àÄ i j k, pullback (f i j) (f i k) ‚ü∂ pullback (f j k) (f j i)
  t_fac : ‚àÄ i j k, t' i j k ‚â´ pullback.snd = pullback.fst ‚â´ t i j
  t_inv' : ‚àÄ i j, i ‚â† j ‚Üí t i j ‚â´ t j i = ùüô _
  cocycle : ‚àÄ i j k, i ‚â† j ‚Üí j ‚â† k ‚Üí k ‚â† i ‚Üí t' i j k ‚â´ t' j k i ‚â´ t' k i j = ùüô _

namespace GlueData'

attribute [simp] t_id
attribute [instance] f_id f_mono f_hasPullback
attribute [reassoc] t_fac cocycle

variable {C}
variable (D : GlueData' C)

@[simp]
theorem t'_iij (i j : D.J) : D.t' i i j = (pullbackSymmetry _ _).hom := by
  have eq‚ÇÅ := D.t_fac i i j
  have eq‚ÇÇ := (IsIso.eq_comp_inv (D.f i i)).mpr (@pullback.condition _ _ _ _ _ _ (D.f i j) _)
  rw [D.t_id, Category.comp_id, eq‚ÇÇ] at eq‚ÇÅ
  have eq‚ÇÉ := (IsIso.eq_comp_inv (D.f i i)).mp eq‚ÇÅ
  rw [Category.assoc, ‚Üê pullback.condition, ‚Üê Category.assoc] at eq‚ÇÉ
  exact
    Mono.right_cancellation _ _
      ((Mono.right_cancellation _ _ eq‚ÇÉ).trans (pullbackSymmetry_hom_comp_fst _ _).symm)

theorem t'_jii (i j : D.J) : D.t' j i i = pullback.fst ‚â´ D.t j i ‚â´ inv pullback.snd := by
  rw [‚Üê Category.assoc, ‚Üê D.t_fac]
  simp

theorem t'_iji (i j : D.J) : D.t' i j i = pullback.fst ‚â´ D.t i j ‚â´ inv pullback.snd := by
  rw [‚Üê Category.assoc, ‚Üê D.t_fac]
  simp

@[reassoc, elementwise (attr := simp)]
theorem t_inv (i j : D.J) : D.t i j ‚â´ D.t j i = ùüô _ := by
  by_cases h : i = j
  ¬∑ subst h
    simp
  ¬∑ exact D.t_inv' _ _ h

theorem t'_inv (i j k : D.J) :
    D.t' i j k ‚â´ (pullbackSymmetry _ _).hom ‚â´ D.t' j i k ‚â´ (pullbackSymmetry _ _).hom = ùüô _ := by
  rw [‚Üê cancel_mono (pullback.fst : pullback (D.f i j) (D.f i k) ‚ü∂ _)]
  simp [t_fac, t_fac_assoc]

instance t_isIso (i j : D.J) : IsIso (D.t i j) :=
  ‚ü®‚ü®D.t j i, D.t_inv _ _, D.t_inv _ _‚ü©‚ü©

-- instance t'_isIso (i j k : D.J) : IsIso (D.t' i j k) :=
--   ‚ü®‚ü®D.t' j k i ‚â´ D.t' k i j, D.cocycle _ _ _, by simpa using D.cocycle _ _ _‚ü©‚ü©

def glueData (D : GlueData' C) : GlueData C where
  __ := D
  cocycle i j k := by
    dsimp
    by_cases hij : i = j
    ¬∑ subst hij
      rw [D.t'_iij, D.t'_jii, D.t'_iji]
      ext
      ¬∑ simp [fst_eq_snd_of_mono_eq, t_inv_assoc]
      ¬∑ simp [fst_eq_snd_of_mono_eq]
    by_cases hjk : j = k
    ¬∑ subst hjk
      rw [D.t'_iij, D.t'_jii, D.t'_iji]
      ext
      ¬∑ simp [fst_eq_snd_of_mono_eq, t_inv_assoc]
      ¬∑ simp [fst_eq_snd_of_mono_eq]
    by_cases hki : k = i
    ¬∑ subst hki
      rw [D.t'_iij, D.t'_jii, D.t'_iji]
      ext
      ¬∑ simp [fst_eq_snd_of_mono_eq, t_inv_assoc]
      ¬∑ rw [‚Üê cancel_mono (D.f k k)]
        simp [fst_eq_snd_of_mono_eq, t_inv_assoc, pullback.condition]
    exact D.cocycle i j k hij hjk hki

end GlueData'
```

GlueData' is indeed useful; my [GlueData.mk‚ÇÇ](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14167/files#diff-84f8c7bdded56b516d33e74834faf603f2a1cc1c213351b2f10f72a851b94cfcR78-R96) is a baby version of it. But maybe we can add the `i ‚â† j` conditions to `V, f, f_mono, f_hasPullback, t, t', t_fac` and get rid of `f_id` and `t_id`?

Hmmm, then the data becomes a dependent function... and we would get even more `if then else`s everywhere. I suppose it could work...

At least, I think we can consider splitting the data into a structure (maybe this can be called `GlueData`?) and then different kinds of ways to check the axioms can be put on top of that.
I'll try out the approach Johan mentioned. `GlueData.mk‚ÇÇ` is definitely useful, but I don't think we should introduce `if then else` everywhere.
After some more thought, I think `GlueData'` is only useful when `i = j` and `i =/= j` need different approaches, so maybe adding `i ‚â† j` in the data makes sense as well.

There is quite a lot going on in this PR. I see at least four contributions:
1. `GlueData'`
2. Disjoint unions of schemes.
3. Disjoint unions of prime spectra.
4. General API about pullbacks/pushouts/strict initials.

It would be much easier to review this important work if you could break up this PR into smaller pieces.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14548~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14549~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14550~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14551~~
